data.text: @AndySzilagyi I don’t think it is over.  Here in CA, people have really relaxed their Covid protections.
@AndySzilagyi eye mucosa to duct . . . that was the proposition. But havent seen theory, hypotheses or tests on this. How come?
@AndySzilagyi I trust nobody and mask up for my sake. Health is underrated.
@AndySzilagyi Infection via eyes was part of public discourse early on. This has faded. But I've not heard/read evidence contradicting. Am I  uninformed?
@AndySzilagyi I'm still following previous protocol, because I call bs on this being over.

@tlss2026 I've always wondered about the eyes.
I get the masks for your mouth and nose and not getting particles out there, but in the general public, the eyes are not covered or protected. I'm guessing getting covid particles in your eye will infect you the same way.
@AndySzilagyi N95s, ski goggles . . . You'll look like an insect but might feel better
@AndySzilagyi True, but I trust my BLUE state and my BLUE county. I witnessed complete compliance of mask wearing in my county for two years. It’s paid off!
@BettyMB2 The only problem with that is, if states don't actually report their numbers, or fudge them, the NYT is only as accurate as the submitted numbers.
@AndySzilagyi I subscribe to NYT where you can request Covid stats for your county, stare jand the U.S. The numbers have been steadily decreasing for my county in Illinois, the state and the U.S.
